items.title: 'They just don't disappear into thin air': Hopes fading for boy missing in outback
items.summary: A desperate search for a boy missing from an outback property for six days has failed to turn up fresh evidence, as defence personnel join the operation.

items.title: In a battle to build, these five charts show Labor's housing headache
items.summary: There are doubts major inroads into Australia's housing supply problem can be made in a couple of years and questions over the government's "ambitious" 2029 target. So, what can be done?

items.title: Albanese welcomes PNG's decision to sign landmark defence pact
items.summary: The pact will elevate the Pacific partnership, ensuring an attack on one would be a "danger to the peace and security of both countries".

items.title: I started feeling sick making lunch — and never could've expected what came next
items.summary: Corinne Laurent doesn’t believe she would still be alive if not for her smartwatch.

items.title: 'No more signs of life': Dozens remain missing after Indonesian school collapse
items.summary: After days of rescue operations, 59 people were still feared buried under the rubble after at least five people had been confirmed dead.

items.title: 'Blood on their hands': Row erupts over Lost Dogs Home's puppy euthanasia decision
items.summary: A couple who had fostered the dog, Murphy, had called Victoria's Lost Dogs Home to ask how he was going, only to be told he would be put down.

items.title: Man cleared of involvement after police swoop on property in search for Dezi Freeman
items.summary: Police hunting Australia's most wanted fugitive have targeted an area far away from where he was last sighted after he allegedly shot dead two officers.

items.title: Erin Patterson to appeal murder convictions over deadly mushroom lunch, lawyer says
items.summary: Patterson's legal team will have 28 days to lodge the relevant paperwork before a court considers whether to approve the appeal.

items.title: Magnitude-6.9 earthquake kills more than 70 people in the Philippines
items.summary: The quake, which struck off the central island of Cebu, was the country's deadliest in more than a decade.

items.title: Is your sunscreen safe? What to know amid Australia's SPF ratings storm
items.summary: Eighteen sunscreens have either been recalled or had their sale paused in Australia. Here's what you need to know as the weather gets warmer.

items.title: Jane Goodall, pioneering scientist and conservationist, dies at 91
items.summary: The primatologist drew the public into the wild with her groundbreaking research, later shifting to climate advocacy.

items.title: It happened 'by accident', but Mark is helping tackle a $2.7bn Australian problem
items.summary: Loneliness among men has been described as a "crisis" in Australia, and its estimated to cost the health system billions each year.

items.title: Pizza, porn, and getting high: Inside the grip of a severe tech addiction
items.summary: Technology seems a non-negotiable part of everyday life. For Quentin, it became an addiction. After years of trying different ways to break free, it was a 12-step program that helped her into recovery.

items.title: Fast entry or backwards step? What Labor's new housing scheme means for you
items.summary: Analysis shows the government's new First Home Guarantee scheme could slash years off savings times — but experts warn it could come at a cost.

items.title: Democrats take aim at 'erratic and unhinged' Trump as US government shuts down
items.summary: The White House, meanwhile, has blamed the Democrats for the shutdown, which has healthcare as a key sticking point.

items.title: The US government has shut down. What happens now?
items.summary: The US government has entered a shutdown, meaning thousands of federal employees are being placed on leave or asked to work without pay until the government reopens.

items.title: Class action alleging racial discrimination in Work for the Dole scheme could involve 20,000 claimants
items.summary: The class action claims the work for the dole scheme unfairly targeted Indigenous people.

items.title: New move in latest Optus triple-zero failure, as Albanese says it 'failed customers'
items.summary: Anthony Albanese says Optus has "failed" its customers and has called for the company to "be transparent".

items.title: SPF slip-ups: More sunscreens withdrawn as TGA finds claims don't stack up
items.summary: The Therapeutic Goods Administration has announced 21 more sunscreen products, all linked to the same base formulation, are under review after failing to provide the SPF protection they advertise.

items.title: Albanese 'concerned' over China's reported BHP iron ore ban
items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese hopes a pricing dispute between China and the Australian mining giant will be resolved "very quickly".

items.title: 'Invasion from within': Trump says US cities should be used as military training grounds
items.summary: Donald Trump said that under his administration, the US military was now "reawakening the warrior spirit".

items.title: A new push for peace: What part did Australia play in the 20-point plan for Gaza?
items.summary: Anthony Albanese's stopover in the Middle East came after more lengthy engagements in the US — for the leaders' week at the United Nations — and the UK.

items.title: 'Very sad end': Hamas under pressure as Trump issues deadline on Gaza peace plan
items.summary: Mediators from Qatar and Egypt shared the document with Hamas, which was not involved in negotiations in the lead-up to the 20-point plan.

items.title: Nicole Kidman files for divorce from Keith Urban, citing 'irreconcilable differences'
items.summary: Oscar-winning star Nicole Kidman and Grammy-winning country musician Keith Urban had been living apart for some time, according to US media reports.
